column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|12 letters]] to [[Dorothy Wood]]'''.

column1: *'''Subject(s):''' Among the subjects discussed are [[Wikipedia:Elizabeth II|the Queen]] ("I am one of her devoted subjects and greatly admire her
column2: though her voice is not one of her graces")
column8: 1st Earl of Snowdon|Lord Snowdon]] ("...a very thin almost '[[Elves|elvish]]' figure... we had much in common - especially a devotion to [[trees]]...").<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=72520|articlename=English Literature and History. 2004|dated=|website=TB|accessed=5 April 2012}}</ref>

column1: *'''Publication:''' A description of and quotes from the letters appeared in ''[[Sotheby's English Literature

column2: unpublished letter to an unidentified Dorothy
